review.comment_positive: Fantastic room & staff. Seriously great value for the cost. I'm English speaking and the staff made communication a breeze. If I'm ever back in Hoi An this is where I'll stay. 10/10... highly recommend!

review.rating: A jewel in the heart of Hoi An
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive Ä‘Ã´i nhiÌ€n ra há»“ bÆ¡i
review.comment_positive:
The hotel has a great location just a few steps from Hoin Old city centre (5 minutes walk). Everything was perfect during our stay. The staff quite helpful and even more, always with a big smile and taking care of us. The two receptionists (Chloe and Iris) gave us really nice tips about where to eat and places for visit (shops, shows, spa, ...).
We booked a facing pool room on 1st and 2nd floor; both of them were spacious, with a 2x2 very confortable bed and pillows; nice bathroom with a huge shower (2nd floor room) or a nice bath (1st floor). The rooms were pretty clean with a nice balcony with pool views.
Breakfast was served in the garden with a variety of Asian and European food, good coffee and tasted fruit juices.
I can only recommend this hotel to all who want to stay in the heart of the city for a very reasonable rate.
We will definitely come back to this hotel.
Thanks to all the staff for making us to have a wonderful memories of Hoi An.

review.comment_positive: Exceptional hospitality. All the staffs were super attentive and the receptionists were informative, especially thanks to Irish. The room was spacious, very comfortable beds and all room came with 2 umbrellas. It's very helpful for us as now it's the raining season. Besides, the morning breakfast had quite a good variety of foods. The staffs will clean all the used plate right after it's empty. Furthermore, the location is superb. Walkable distance to most of our favourable restaurants and very near to the central market and local attractions. It's definitely value for money. High recommended!!

review.comment_positive: Big and clean room and bathroom, comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast, excellent location.

Staff was very helpful and knowledgable about the area. The manager here assisted us with our check-in and provided us with information of sight-seeings, places to eat, and tours around Hoi An. There were some confusions at first about the extra charge for a child traveling with us, but it was quickly resolved. Manager also offered us a complementary room upgrade. Buffet breakfast was good with lots of options, and staffs were well-trained in terms of assisting guests as well as cleaning plates off the table. The hotel is just 5-8 minutes walk to Old Quarter, and they also have bikes if you'd rather not walk. Room was very clean and spacious. The pool water is also clean and sitting area around the pool gets tidy up quite often.
review.comment_negative: There were lots of mosquitos in the room but it's a quick fix with some bug spray.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive Ä‘Ã´i nhiÌ€n ra há»“ bÆ¡i
review.comment_positive:
Location is perfect for Hoi An - walk to the old city centre and all the sites of the city. 
Breakfast is plentiful with a variety of options for different tastes - vietnamese, western, etc. lots of fruit, breads!
Room is spacious with effective AC, comfortable bed, large shower. Bottled water provided daily! 
Employees were absolutely fantastic, so helpful and polite, walking us through different local tour options and coordinating them with the tour providers for us so that we didnt have to figure out what to book. They took all payment directly as well so we didnt have to carry around tons of money.
They have bikes you can also take out, and umbrellas in the rooms, so you do not need to bring them yourself.
review.comment_negative: Slight downside is soundproofing and hot water can be slightly limited, but water was never cold.

review.comment_positive: The rooms are great and also large plus all the things you need.  The breakfast is incredible and there is a good variety.  The staff is very attentive and helpful.  I used the free hotel bikes to ride around the town. They really want your stay to be outstanding.
review.comment_negative: The weather was mostly rainy, but I had a fun time anyway.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra Cáº£nh ThÃ nh Phá»‘ Hoáº·c VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive:
Marvellous! From the begging was a wonderful experience, they are very welcoming in every single detail. The room was huge, clean and tidy as same as I expected at the time of to book, it has a nice balcony with a city view which enhance it even more. At the courtyard, there's this beautiful and almost scenery pool, and next to it there was the buffet with amazing breakfast every morning, the service was amazing, always keep an eye on you (as a vegan) there were always options available. The location is perfect, 5 to 10 min walking to the Old Town, maybe 3 min to the market, surrounded by local restaurants.
Overall, I recommend 100% this hotel, when coming back to Hoi An there wouldn't be any doubt or even hesitation that I come back here. Amazing people and amazing service.
Lady at the reception was very nice. We stayed in Hoi An 1 day and she advised us what to see and where to try to eat without asking her.

review.rating: Good place to stay in Hoian
review.comment_positive: The hotel is located within minutes of walking to the conservation area where main attractions and places of interest are. The hotel is clean and well-run. The staff speaks relatively good English and is professional and helpful. The breakfast is alright, although it could have been more varied. The hotel is situated between two main roads. Ask for a room somewhere in the middle and it would be quiet, as it was in our case (room 3). I'll recommend this hotel for a stay in Hoian.

I stayed here for 3 nights. First of all, the location of the hotel is very convenient, as it is only a 15-minute walk to the Japanese bridge and Hoi An market. There are cafes, pharmacy, spa, and souvenir shops in front of the hotel.
 The entrance to the hotel is open and the space is a fusion of Vietnamese, Chinese, and European architecture, and it is lovely. Overall, the hotel is clean and the pool is beautiful. The plants were well cared for and managed. It was a good decision to book the breakfast package. (The hotel is located in front of a cafÃ©, pharmacy, spa, and souvenir shop, which serves bread, Vietnamese food, egg dishes, salads, Vietnamese coffee, tea, fruit juices, tropical fruits, etc. It was early April, so it was dry season, but the temperature was over 30â„ƒ during the day, so walking was not an option. It was very helpful to get to places that were inconvenient to go by cab. We were on the right side of the road.

review.rating: Amazing colonial hotel in old town but away from the hustle bustle to let you take life at your pace
review.comment_positive:
Room- large colonial style rooms with old world charm, modern conveniences, an AC that cooled the room rapidly and comfy beds. the only room in Vietnam with a desk and a chair in our trip. Large windows in the room and bathroom give you an amazing sense of space
Breakfast-a reasonable spread next to the pool with a couple of tables set in the lawn and rest in a verandah.
Pool- very nice small pool quite shallow with a few deck chairs around. amazing facility set in the back so nice and quiet and private with lots of tall flowering plants leading to a pleasant atmosphere.
Staff were very knowledgable and guided us to excellent experiences which we may have missed otherwise. Did not feel as if we were being overcharged at any time.
worth the money we spent.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Executive GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i NhÃ¬n Ra Cáº£nh ThÃ nh Phá»‘ Hoáº·c VÆ°á»n
review.comment_positive: Het hotel heeft een prachtige tuin waar we vanaf ons balkon op uitkeken. De kamers en de rest van het hotel zijn erg mooi en alles voelt vers. Bij sommige hotels zijn de foto's wat optimistisch maar dat is hier zeker niet het geval. Alles ziet er mooi uit. Het bed dat wij hadden is het meest comfortabele bed dat ik tijdens de rondreis ben tegengekomen. Qua locatie ligt het perfect. Met twee stappen sta je in het oude centrum. review.comment_positive: Good hotel with an excellent location near to the old town. Staff allowed us to pay for our airport transport by credit card, and were otherwise always flexible and helpful. Breakfast in the morning was good, though admittedly suffered in comparison to other more spectacular breakfasts we'd had elsewhere in Vietnam. Worth staying mainly for the location.
review.comment_negative: We had booked two rooms - one was significantly better than the other. The larger one, at the back of the second building, had no issues; the one next door seemed less frequently used, and periodically had bad smells, insects in the bathroom, and felt damp. To their credit, when notified of this the staff sent an immediate clean-up team to the room, including an electric lemongrass humidifier that counteracted the bad smell and successfully made the room much nicer.

review.rating: Lovely hotel in the center of Hoi An
review.comment_positive: We arrived at this hotel in the pouring rain after a long bus ride. The staff greeted us with a cup of ginger tea and showed us to a lovely, clean room with a hot shower and a soft bed. The hotel is located in easy walking distance of the markets and plenty of good restaurants. If it hadn't been raining we would have gone to the beach, which is an easy bike ride from the hotel. Breakfast was amazing. They have umbrellas and bikes available for use, and the staff is very helpful with tour planning (they arranged a tour to My Son for us).

review.rating: Home away from home and unmatched customer service
review.comment_positive: Where does one begin? Do I begin with the price factor, the excellent breakfast, accessibility to nearby locations, the super comfy swimming pool or the ultra excellent customer service? Because for us Hoian Central Hotel was all of the above. We were in touch with the amazing Jasmine (who's undoubtedly the best customer service hotel personnel I've come across in my life) from the start of our trip; she even arranged for airport transfers (Da Nang to Hoi An and back), checked us in and handed over a tip sheet with recommendations for great food, local sightseeing and non touristy recommendations. Jasmine checked us in as if we were her family members; such was the level of commitment. The rooms were next level, the massive bathroom with amazing aesthetic fittings and the strong Wi-Fi just kept us going. The breakfast was an amazing array of local Vietnamese delicacies and European selection. Jasmine's colleagues Chloe and the lady from the breakfast stall were super friendly. I took my mandatory laps in the pool to cool down from the humid heat of Hoi An and it was very refreshing. Also, at the hotel you can use their complimentary bicycles to go around the city; we hiked 11 kms to the beautiful An Bang beach courtesy the bikes. To sum up, the experience that Hoian Central Hotel gave us thanks to their staff members will be with us for the rest of our life; I doubt if anyone could match their price point and even their hospitality service. Keep up the great work!

Si se puede, pedir con vistas a la piscina que es preciosa y no hay ruido alguno. El desayuno tambiÃ©n muy bien.

Pero lo mejor de todo el personal. Le preguntÃ© a la encargada de recepciÃ³n -Iris- por unos caramelos que ofrecen ahÃ­ y me dijo que se podÃ­an comprar en tiendas del centro.

Al dÃ­a siguiente me preguntÃ³ si los habÃ­a encontrado y le dije que noâ€¦Â¡y me regalÃ³ una bolsa de caramelos que me habÃ­a comprado! Alucinante.

JamÃ¡s en la vida me habÃ­a pasado nada parecido. Una de las mejores cosas del viaje, la verdad.

review.comment_positive: Beautiful hotel with the classic Vietnam architecture and wooden furnishings. The room and bathroom were both spacious and clean. The balcony was a lovely touch to chill out and enjoy the view of the courtyard and pool at the end of a long day out. The pool was also a great place to cool down from the heat. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, I especially enjoyed the iced coffee and mi quang. Close to the centre with just a short walk. The girls at reception were so lovely and sweet and were helpful with all the questions we had and booked our day tour to My Son. Highly recommend staying here and will hopefully return soon!

review.comment_positive: This is a great property, near the old town with lovely rooms, AC and fans, a pool and courtyard.  The staff were fantastic and helped me organize activities, arranged laundry and transport.  You can use hotel bicycles to get to the beach and around town.  Nice towels and linens and the room was quiet.  I had a great balcony with a view over the garden.
review.comment_negative: My first hotel room had a balcony door that didnâ€™t lock well.

review.comment_positive: Staff went over and above to do little things for you and to help you as best they could. Example: offering small trays of cut up fruit and glasses of juice while relaxing around the pool, purchasing a heater to deal with the dampness in our room, always remembering who we were and being very engaging.
review.comment_negative: It was very damp and humid in our room. Everything from clothes to bedding to even envelopes and pieces of paper picked up moisture and was impossible to get rid of. It was a constant feeling of clammyness and dampness that permeated everything. Even myself. The staff brought in a plug in heater to the room but the dampness was just too big a problem.for a small heater. Even the walls felt damp. It was quite uncomfortable and only resolved by checking out and going to our next hotel.

review.comment_positive: Location was perfect, just at the edge of old town and a quick walk to all the action in Hoi An. We had 2 rooms and were not able to get them next to each other but both rooms were comfortable and in traditional style.   The best part of this hotel is location and staff.  Free bikes for rent is a great plus - good condition and my husband took it to explore going over to the beach early in the morning.

But this is just part of the area/feel of the space.

I would 100% come back to this hotel! They had free bikes to use for guests to get around as well which was an added bonus. Staff are incredible !! Thank you so much for the stay.

review.comment_positive: Fantastic location right beside the old town but still the hotel inside is calm and quiet. Large spacious rooms, spotlessly clean, balcony to sit on. Great to have a pool to relax in after the hustle and bustle of the town. Also canâ€™t compliment the staff enough - they were so helpful and lovely. We stayed a week and they were concerned about making sure we werenâ€™t bored with breakfast which was so nice! When we were leaving they all came out to wave us off which was lovely!

The hotel is a good choice if you want to stay within walking distance of the Old Town. That said, they have bicycles to borrow if you want to stray further afield. The room had all I needed and the breakfast had a wide choice, served by a very helpful staff. The reception staff were efficient in arranging a car and driver for trips to My Son and back to Danang station. There are plenty of spas, restaurants, and shops nearby. I would stay at the Central again.

review.comment_positive: lâ€™accueil

LocalizaÃ§Ã£o maravilhosa. 
CafÃ© da manhÃ£ muito bom

Amazing location, big and comfortable rooms, Superb staff!! A 2 minute walk takes you to the Old Town/Old quarter, which is where everything is. The most famous restaurant serving the lip smacking local  dishes Mi Quang and Cao Lai is right in the alley next to the hotel. Almost everywhere is walking distance. We had 2 rooms, and they were both very large, comfortable and clean. There was a ceiling fan as well as AC for a change. In that kind of humidity, a fan is a must!! The breakfast was quite nice, with a good combination of local and continental cuisine. The most standout aspect of the hotel is the staff. Special shout out to Chloe. She helped us figure out where everything was, on a map that they keep for their guests, showed us the best walking route to the Memories of Hoi An show, and actually called her mom to find out how I could buy Cao Lai noodles to take back home. When we were leaving the hotel, for Danang, the staff gave us bottles of water, and a big packet of coconut biscuits for the road trip ahead. The hospitality is on another level!! For Salt Coffee fans, there's a salt coffee stall in the lane right behind the.hotel that sells amazing Ca phe Muoi for just 15K Dong. 
Would most definitely recommend this hotel!!
